info.title: ResourceManagementClient
info.description: Provides operations for working with resources and resource groups.

get.description: Lists all of the available Microsoft.Resources REST API operations.

200.description: OK. The request has succeeded.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Unregisters a subscription from a resource provider.

parameters.name: resourceProviderNamespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the resource provider to unregister.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the resource provider.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Registers a management group with a resource provider. Use this operation to register a resource provider with resource types that can be deployed at the management group scope. It does not recursively register subscriptions within the management group. Instead, you must register subscriptions individually.

parameters.name: resourceProviderNamespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the resource provider to register.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the resource provider.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceProviderNamespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the resource provider.

200.description: OK - Returns information on the provider permissions.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of resource providers.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of resource providers.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the resource provider.

get.description: Get all the resources for a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The resource group with the resources to get.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
The filter to apply on the operation.

The properties you can use for eq (equals) or ne (not equals) are: location, resourceType, name, resourceGroup, identity, identity/principalId, plan, plan/publisher, plan/product, plan/name, plan/version, and plan/promotionCode.

For example, to filter by a resource type, use: $filter=resourceType eq 'Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks'

You can use substringof(value, property) in the filter. The properties you can use for substring are: name and resourceGroup.

For example, to get all resources with 'demo' anywhere in the name, use: $filter=substringof('demo', name)

You can link more than one substringof together by adding and/or operators.

You can filter by tag names and values. For example, to filter for a tag name and value, use $filter=tagName eq 'tag1' and tagValue eq 'Value1'. When you filter by a tag name and value, the tags for each resource are not returned in the results.

You can use some properties together when filtering. The combinations you can use are: substringof and/or resourceType, plan and plan/publisher and plan/name, identity and identity/principalId.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of additional properties to be included in the response. Valid values include `createdTime`, `changedTime` and `provisioningState`. For example, `$expand=createdTime,changedTime`.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of results to return. If null is passed, returns all resources.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of resources

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

head.description: Checks whether a resource group exists.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to check. The name is case insensitive.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to create or update. Can include alphanumeric, underscore, parentheses, hyphen, period (except at end), and Unicode characters that match the allowed characters.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update a resource group.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the new resource group.

201.description: Created - Returns information about the new resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: When you delete a resource group, all of its resources are also deleted. Deleting a resource group deletes all of its template deployments and currently stored operations.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to delete. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: forceDeletionTypes
parameters.description: The resource types you want to force delete. Currently, only the following is supported: forceDeletionTypes=Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines,Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachineScaleSets

200.description: OK

location.description: URL to get status of this long-running operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to get. The name is case insensitive.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Resource groups can be updated through a simple PATCH operation to a group address. The format of the request is the same as that for creating a resource group. If a field is unspecified, the current value is retained.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to update. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to update a resource group.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Captures the specified resource group as a template.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for exporting the template.

200.description: OK - Returns the result of the export.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all the resource groups for a subscription.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
The filter to apply on the operation.

You can filter by tag names and values. For example, to filter for a tag name and value, use $filter=tagName eq 'tag1' and tagValue eq 'Value1'

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of results to return. If null is passed, returns all resource groups.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of resource groups.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Moves resources from one resource group to another resource group.
post.description: The resources to be moved must be in the same source resource group in the source subscription being used. The target resource group may be in a different subscription. When moving resources, both the source group and the target group are locked for the duration of the operation. Write and delete operations are blocked on the groups until the move completes.

parameters.name: sourceResourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group from the source subscription containing the resources to be moved.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for moving resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Validates whether resources can be moved from one resource group to another resource group.
post.description: This operation checks whether the specified resources can be moved to the target. The resources to be moved must be in the same source resource group in the source subscription being used. The target resource group may be in a different subscription. If validation succeeds, it returns HTTP response code 204 (no content). If validation fails, it returns HTTP response code 409 (Conflict) with an error message. Retrieve the URL in the Location header value to check the result of the long-running operation.

parameters.name: sourceResourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group from the source subscription containing the resources to be validated for move.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for moving resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get all the resources in a subscription.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
The filter to apply on the operation.

Filter comparison operators include `eq` (equals) and `ne` (not equals) and may be used with the following properties: `location`, `resourceType`, `name`, `resourceGroup`, `identity`, `identity/principalId`, `plan`, `plan/publisher`, `plan/product`, `plan/name`, `plan/version`, and `plan/promotionCode`.

For example, to filter by a resource type, use `$filter=resourceType eq 'Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks'`


`substringof(value, property)` can be used to filter for substrings of the following currently-supported properties: `name` and `resourceGroup`

For example, to get all resources with 'demo' anywhere in the resource name, use `$filter=substringof('demo', name)`

Multiple substring operations can also be combined using `and`/`or` operators.

Note that any truncated number of results queried via `$top` may also not be compatible when using a filter.


Resources can be filtered by tag names and values. For example, to filter for a tag name and value, use `$filter=tagName eq 'tag1' and tagValue eq 'Value1'`. Note that when resources are filtered by tag name and value, the original tags for each resource will not be returned in the results. Any list of additional properties queried via `$expand` may also not be compatible when filtering by tag names/values.

For tag names only, resources can be filtered by prefix using the following syntax: `$filter=startswith(tagName, 'depart')`. This query will return all resources with a tag name prefixed by the phrase `depart` (i.e.`department`, `departureDate`, `departureTime`, etc.)


Note that some properties can be combined when filtering resources, which include the following: `substringof() and/or resourceType`, `plan and plan/publisher and plan/name`, and `identity and identity/principalId`.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of additional properties to be included in the response. Valid values include `createdTime`, `changedTime` and `provisioningState`. For example, `$expand=createdTime,changedTime`.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of recommendations per page if a paged version of this API is being used.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

head.description: Checks by ID whether a resource exists. This API currently works only for a limited set of Resource providers. In the event that a Resource provider does not implement this API, ARM will respond with a 405. The alternative then is to use the GET API to check for the existence of the resource.

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The fully qualified ID of the resource, including the resource name and resource type. Use the format, /subscriptions/{guid}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/{resource-provider-namespace}/{resource-type}/{resource-name}

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

delete.summary: Deletes a predefined tag value for a predefined tag name.
delete.description: This operation allows deleting a value from the list of predefined values for an existing predefined tag name. The value being deleted must not be in use as a tag value for the given tag name for any resource.

parameters.name: tagName
parameters.description: The name of the tag.

parameters.name: tagValue
parameters.description: The value of the tag to delete.

200.description: Predefined tag value successfully deleted.

204.description: Predefined tag value did not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.summary: Creates a predefined value for a predefined tag name.
put.description: This operation allows adding a value to the list of predefined values for an existing predefined tag name. A tag value can have a maximum of 256 characters.

parameters.name: tagName
parameters.description: The name of the tag.

parameters.name: tagValue
parameters.description: The value of the tag to create.

200.description: Predefined tag value already exists. Returns information about the predefined tag value.

201.description: Predefined tag value successfully created. Returns information about the predefined tag value.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: This operation allows adding a name to the list of predefined tag names for the given subscription. A tag name can have a maximum of 512 characters and is case-insensitive. Tag names cannot have the following prefixes which are reserved for Azure use: 'microsoft', 'azure', 'windows'.

parameters.name: tagName
parameters.description: The name of the tag to create.

200.description: Predefined tag name already exists. Returns information about the predefined tag name.

201.description: Predefined tag name successfully created. Returns information about the predefined tag name.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: This operation allows deleting a name from the list of predefined tag names for the given subscription. The name being deleted must not be in use as a tag name for any resource. All predefined values for the given name must have already been deleted.

parameters.name: tagName
parameters.description: The name of the tag.

200.description: Predefined tag name successfully deleted.

204.description: Predefined tag name did not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Gets a summary of tag usage under the subscription.
get.description: This operation performs a union of predefined tags, resource tags, resource group tags and subscription tags, and returns a summary of usage for each tag name and value under the given subscription. In case of a large number of tags, this operation may return a previously cached result.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of tag names and values.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.summary: Creates or updates the entire set of tags on a resource or subscription.
put.description: This operation allows adding or replacing the entire set of tags on the specified resource or subscription. The specified entity can have a maximum of 50 tags.

200.description: Tags updated successfully. Returns tags from the specified object.

Location.description: URL to get status of this long-running operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.summary: Selectively updates the set of tags on a resource or subscription.
patch.description: This operation allows replacing, merging or selectively deleting tags on the specified resource or subscription. The specified entity can have a maximum of 50 tags at the end of the operation. The 'replace' option replaces the entire set of existing tags with a new set. The 'merge' option allows adding tags with new names and updating the values of tags with existing names. The 'delete' option allows selectively deleting tags based on given names or name/value pairs.

200.description: Tags updated successfully. Returns tags from the specified object.

Location.description: URL to get status of this long-running operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Gets the entire set of tags on a resource or subscription.

200.description: Returns tags from the specified object.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.summary: Deletes the entire set of tags on a resource or subscription.

200.description: Tags successfully deleted.

Location.description: URL to get status of this long-running operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

CloudError.description: An error response for a resource management request.

values.description: The token type is not specified.
The token type can be anything.

type.description: The type of the token that the alias path is referring to.

values.description: The token that the alias path is referring to has no attributes.
The token that the alias path is referring to is modifiable by policies with 'modify' effect.

attributes.description: The attributes of the token that the alias path is referring to.

pattern.description: The pattern for an alias path.

metadata.description: The metadata of the alias path. If missing, fall back to the default metadata of the alias.

AliasPath.description: The type of the paths for alias.

values.description: Extract is the only allowed value.

AliasPattern.description: The type of the pattern for an alias path.

values.description: Alias type is unknown (same as not providing alias type).

defaultPath.description: The default path for an alias.

defaultPattern.description: The default pattern for an alias.

defaultMetadata.description: The default alias path metadata. Applies to the default path and to any alias path that doesn't have metadata

locationMappings.description: The location mappings that are supported by this resource type.

aliases.description: The aliases that are supported by this resource type.

apiProfiles.description: The API profiles for the resource provider.

capabilities.description: The additional capabilities offered by this resource type.

namespace.description: The namespace of the resource provider.

registrationState.description: The registration state of the resource provider.

managedBy.description: ID of the resource that manages this resource.

changedTime.description: The changed time of the resource. This is only present if requested via the $expand query parameter.

The principal id of user assigned identity.

The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

id.description: The ID of the resource group.

name.description: The name of the resource group.

type.description: The type of the resource group.

location.description: The location of the resource group. It cannot be changed after the resource group has been created. It must be one of the supported Azure locations.

managedBy.description: The ID of the resource that manages this resource group.

tags.description: The tags attached to the resource group.

name.description: The name of the resource group.

managedBy.description: The ID of the resource that manages this resource group.

tags.description: The tags attached to the resource group.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

resources.description: The IDs of the resources to filter the export by. To export all resources, supply an array with single entry '*'.

options.description: The export template options. A CSV-formatted list containing zero or more of the following: 'IncludeParameterDefaultValue', 'IncludeComments', 'SkipResourceNameParameterization', 'SkipAllParameterization'

outputFormat.description: The output format for the exported resources.

ExportTemplateRequest.description: Export resource group template request parameters.

count.description: The total number of resources that use the resource tag. When a tag is initially created and has no associated resources, the value is 0.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

template.description: The template content. Used if outputFormat is empty or set to 'Json'.

output.description: The formatted export content. Used if outputFormat is set to 'Bicep'.

display.description: The object that represents the operation.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: Profile, endpoint, etc.

operation.description: Operation type: Read, write, delete, etc.

OperationListResult.description: Result of the request to list Microsoft.Resources operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

Tags.description: A dictionary of name and value pairs.

TagsPatchResource.description: Wrapper resource for tags patch API request only.

operation.description: The operation type for the patch API.

values.description: The 'replace' option replaces the entire set of existing tags with a new set.
The 'merge' option allows adding tags with new names and updating the values of tags with existing names.
The 'delete' option allows selectively deleting tags based on given names or name/value pairs.

isServiceRole.description: If this is a service role.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

consentToAuthorization.description: A value indicating whether authorization is consented or not.

location.description: The location of the zone mapping.
